name: ethoxylated alcohol (AE7) production, palm kernel oil | ethoxylated alcohol (AE7) | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/5624/documentation

This dataset represents the production of 1 kg of ethoxylated alcohol with seven polyether units (AE7) from C12-C15 fatty alcohol derived from palm kernel oil. ;Material and energy input are from literature sources, Transport and infrastructure are estimation based on a large chemical plant. Production of waste and emissions to water and air are calculated based on literature sources.;Flow diagram of the production of alcohol ethoxylates:;[This dataset was already contained in the ecoinvent database version 2. It was not individually updated during the transfer to ecoinvent version 3. Life Cycle Impact Assessment results may still have changed, as they are affected by changes in the supply chain, i.e. in other datasets. This dataset was generated following the ecoinvent quality guidelines for version 2. It may have been subject to central changes described in the ecoinvent version 3 change report (http://www.ecoinvent.org/database/ecoinvent-version-3/reports-of-changes/), and the results of the central updates were reviewed extensively. The changes added e.g. consistent water flows and other information throughout the database. The documentation of this dataset can be found in the ecoinvent reports of version 2, which are still available via the ecoinvent website. The change report linked above covers all central changes that were made during the conversion process.]

From reception of fatty alcohol frompalm kernel oil, ethylene oxide, and nitrogen at the factory gate.

This activity ends with 1 kg of ethoxylated alcohol (AE7). The dataset includes material and energy input, transport, infrastructure, production of waste and emissions to water and air. The datset doesn't include water consumption.
category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/202:Manufacture of other chemical products/2023:Manufacture of soap and detergents, cleaning and polishing preparations, pe

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Data based on the European ethoxylated alcohols production
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Alcohol ethoxylates (AE) are produced by the reaction of fatty alcohols with ethylene oxide leading to a condensation of polyethylene glycolether groups on the alcohol chains. The fatty alcohols can be derived from petrochemical, palm kernel, or coconut oil. The reaction takes place at temperatures ranging from 150°C to 200°C. The grade of ethoxylation, e.g. the specific number of polyether units condensed to the alcohol chains, is controlled by the concentration of ethylene oxide in the ethoxylation process. ;This is an average technology for the production of AE representing typical European production mix in the mid 90s.;Reference:;Schul W. (1995) A Life-Cycle Inventory for the Production of Detergent Range Alcohol Ethoxylates in Europe. In: Tenside, Surfactants, Detergents, 32(2), pp. 171-192.;Stalmans M., Berenbold H., Berna J. L., Cavalli L., Dillarstone A., Franke M., Hirsinger F., Janzen D., Kosswig K., Postlethwaite D., Rappert T., Renta C., Scharer D., Schick K.-P., Schul W., Thomas H. and Sloten R. V. (1995) European Life-Cycle Inventory for Detergent Surfactants Production. In: Tenside, Surfactants, Detergents, 32(2), pp. 84-109
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: see technology This dataset has been copied from an original dataset covering the geography RER. The uncertainty has been adjusted accordingly.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: data out of ECOSOL study of European Surfactant Industry. Common translation rules used, reported in Chemical report (Althaus et al. 2003).

exchanges.description:
EcoSpold01Location=RER
Alcohol Ethoxylates (AE) are molecules with an hydrophobic and an hydrophilic part. The hydrophobic part is formed by fatty alcohols with chain lengths from C9-C18. The hydrophilic part consists of a polyether chain formed by condensation of ethylene oxide to the fatty alcohol. Several hundred different AE are commercially available, differing by alcohol structure and number of polyether units. The generic chemical structure of AE is:
CH3-(CH2)n-CHR-CH2-(O-CH2-CH2)m-OH
(n = 5-15, m = 2-100, R = H or n-alkyl)
AE7 have an average value of seven polyether units (m = 7). 
Alcohol Ethoxylates (AE) are the largest group within the class of nonionic tensides. In comparison with other tensides like anionic surfactants, alcohol ethoxylates exhibit a better fat soil removal capacity, especially at low temperatures.
